introduction: In this session, we will discuss the tree data structure, its terminologies, types, and applications. We will also learn about the post order traversal of a tree data structure.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Tree Data Structure
content: Explanation of tree data structure as a nonlinear data structure.
Discussion on time complexity and accessing elements in a tree.
Introduction of the root node, parent nodes, and children nodes in a tree.
Explanation of degree in a tree and level traversal.
topics: Root Node, Parent, and Children Nodes
Degree and Level Traversal in Trees

sections.title: Section 2: Tree Node and Types of Trees
content: Explanation of tree node and its data, reference to left and right child nodes.
Introduction of four types of trees: binary tree, AVL tree, and B-tree.
Explanation of the balance factor in AVL trees and B-trees.
Discussion on the difference between in-order, preorder, and postorder traversals.
topics: Binary Tree, AVL Tree, and B-tree
Balance Factor in AVL Trees and B-trees

sections.title: Section 3: Post Order Traversal of a Tree Data Structure
content: Explanation of postorder traversal and its purpose.
Example implementation of postorder traversal using an example data structure.
Discussion on the output of the postorder traversal.
Comparison of postorder traversal with other traversal methods.

sections.title: Section 4: Applications of Trees in Real-World Scenarios
content: Explanation of the use of binary search trees for quick element presence checks.
Discussion on the database usage of B-trees.
Introduction of modified tree structures like TRICE for router information storage.
Explanation of the compiler's use of syntax trees for program validation.
topics: Binary Search Trees for Element Presence Checks

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the key concepts covered in the session.
Discussion on the importance of understanding tree data structures.
Suggestions for further learning and practice.
Final thoughts on the session.
topics: Importance of Understanding Tree Data Structures
Balance Factor in AVL Trees and B-trees
Binary Search Trees for Element Presence Checks
